thread.title: 92-year-old man serenades wife with 'their song' w/video
thread.title_full: 92-year-old man serenades wife with 'their song' w/video | www.palmbeachpost.com

author: Zach Dennis
title: 92-year-old man serenades wife with 'their song' w/video
text:
Video can do wonders, and one of the best cases was recently when it was used to capture a tender moment where a 92-year-old man sings to his dying wife of 73 years.
The viral video was captured by Erin Solari and shows her grandfather, Howard, singing “You’ll Never Know” to Laura, his 93-year-old wife, Today reports. The song was known as their song after Laura used to sing it when Howard would go off to fight in World War II.
Howard sings "You'll Never Know" to his wife, Laura. With Laura in hospice and near the end, Howard came to visit her and Solari captured the moment on video. The internet did the rest.
"Moments before this video began, when Grandma heard that Grandpa was in the room, she asked if she could hold him," Solari wrote in the video’s caption . "Grandpa cannot stand on his own, but he immediately pulled his wheelchair close to her bed ready to make it happen. My cousin, Serena, who is a physical therapist, helped him to his feet and held him up throughout the entire song."
Solari adds the two were known to sing the song in a duet, even doing so during the renewal of their vows for their 50 th anniversary.
The video was posted on Sept. 20 and Solari said "as of this posting, my beautiful Grandma Laura Virginia is still with us resting peacefully at home."
Read more at Today .
</span
